page.title: 09TRANSPORT IN DYMCHURCH
page.content: The A259 is a narrow road with one lane in each direction. It stretches from Folkestone to Pevensey. The A259 runs parallel to the sea wall beside Beach Estate. Just recently some traffic lights have been put up for the Pelican Crossing in Dymchurch where a pavement runs on both sides of the road all the way through the Village. The road is directly under the level of the sea wall and in places like Beach Estate the sea splashes on it. These results came from a traffic survey on July 5th 1985 from 9am to 3.30pm: 52% of traffic was going to St. Mary's Bay, 48% towards Hythe. 3% foreign cars, 72% British cars, 1% pedestrians, 12% were lorries and vans, 1% were motorbikes, 3% were bikes, 1% buses, 1% army vehicles.
